required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Verification of the Safety of Normal Food Before a Cerebral Arteriography
clinical_study.official_title: Verification of the Safety of Normal Food Before a Cerebral Arteriography

brief_summary.textblock:
Fasting is currently required before elective cerebral angiography, despite numerous arguments against fasting (kidney toxicity, vasovagal reaction, discomfort) and seams unusefull regarding it's main goal : reducing nausea and vomiting. The investigators propose to assess frequency of nausea and vomiting among patients having taken their breakfast at home before day care angiography.
The investigators hypothesise that less than 1% of non fasting patients will suffer of vomitint.

detailed_description.textblock:
Fasting is currently required before elective cerebral angiography, despite numerous arguments against fasting (kidney toxicity, vasovagal reaction, discomfort) and seams unusefull regarding it's main goal : reducing nausea and vomiting. The investigators propose to assess frequency of nausea and vomiting among patients having taken their breakfast at home before day care angiography.
The investigators hypothesise that less than 1% of non fasting patients will suffer of vomitint.

primary_outcome.measure: frequency of vomiting during arteriographic procedure
primary_outcome.description: The investigators check if there is vomiting or not during the examination noted by an electro radiology manipulator. Safety issue : Bronchus inhalation

secondary_outcome.description: The nausea will be evaluated using an analog visual scale (EVA) by an electro-radiology manipulator (MAR)at the exit of the intervention room

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients benefiting from a cerebral arteriography, within the UMCA of the North LaÃ«nnec Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult,
- non fasting,
- day care hosptilalisation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Childs,
- pregnancy,
- parenteral nutrition,
- nausea,
- vomiting before arteriography,
- arteriography under general anesthesia
